document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Japanese Ablabesmyia (Diptera: Chironomidae: Tanypodinae), with descriptions of three new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Japanese Ablabesmyia (Diptera: Chironomidae: Tanypodinae), with descriptions of three new species

taxonomicName.emphasis: Ablabesmyia ( Ablabesmyia ) prorasha Kobayashi et Kubota

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ablabesmyia monilis : Ree & Kim 1981 : 180
; Sasa & Suzuki 1997 : 340 . [ nec Linnaeus, 1758 ]
Ablabesmyia prorasha Kobayashi et Kubota, 2002 : 323
.

Material examined. Non-type. JAPAN : Fukushima, Hirono, Asami River,
1 male
with pupal and larval exuviae (SUM-IC-T0410),
5 .viii. 2001
(adult emerged
26 .viii. 2001
).
Description. Male (n = 1 ). Body length 3.2 mm .

Colouration. Very similar to A. ( A. )
monilis
, except abdomen entirely pale yellow. Wing (
Fig. 16
) conspicuously darkened on humeral cross-vein, RM, FCu, and on costal vein and surrounding areas at apices of R 1 , R 2 , R 3 and R 4 + 5 . Subbasal and median bands on foretibia located 0.81 and 0.42 , respectively, from apex of tibia.
Head . Temporals 32 , multiserial except uniserial postorbitals. AR 1.8 . Clypeus trapezoid with 40 setae. Lengths of palpomeres 1–5 (μm): 40, 95, 138, 100, 250 .
Thorax . Aps 11 ; Ac 68 , biserial between median scutal vittae; Dc 27 , uniserial; H 7 ; Pa 18 ; Su 1 ; Scts 33 .
Wing . Length 2.0 mm. Squama with 36 setae. VR 0.86 .

Legs . Spur on foretibia 50 μm long with 9 lateral teeth. Spurs on mid tibia 58 and 35 μm long, with 8 and 4 lateral teeth, respectively. Spurs on hind tibia 63 and 30 μm long, with 7 and 4 lateral teeth, respectively; hind tibial comb consisting of 6 bristles. All legs with subapical pseudospurs on ta 1–3 ; claws bifid or pointed apically, each with 2 long and 3 short basoventral spines. Lengths and proportions of leg segments as in
Table 2
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 16–25.
Ablabesmyia ( Ablabesmyia ) prorasha Kobayashi et Kubota
, male (16, 17), pupa (18–20) and larva (21–25). 16, Wing; 17, aedeagal complex, dorsal view; 18, abdominal segment IV, dorsal view, showing pigmentation pattern; 19, abdominal segments VII–IX, dorsal view, all dorsal and left lateral setae omitted; 20, shagreen on posteromedial part of abdominal tergite IV; 21, arrangement of ventral cephalic setae and sensory pore; 22, antenna; 23, maxillary palp with apical stylets; 24, ligula and paraligula, right paraligula omitted; 25, medium- and small-sized claws of posterior parapod.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female. Unknown.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 2. Lengths (μm) and proportions of legs of
Ablabesmyia ( Ablabesmyia ) prorasha Kobayashi et Kubota
, male (n = 1).

subSubSection.paragraph: Pupa (n = 1 ). Body length 4.2 mm .
Cephalothorax . Thoracic horn bulbous, 384 μm long and 1.9 times as long as broadest width; apical nipple crushed. Thoracic comb composed of 11 teeth.
Fourth instar larva (n = 1 ).
Colouration . Head relatively pale yellow with dark postoccipital margin.

Remarks.
Ablabesmyia
( A .)
prorasha
belongs to the A . ( A .)
monilis
species group as defined by Roback ( 1985 , table 1 ).

Kobayashi & Kubota ( 2002 : 323 ) discussed similarities and differences between A . ( A .)
prorasha
and the North American species A . ( A .)
rasha Roback. However
, this species is morphologically much closer, in all life stages, to the North American A. ( A .)
basalis (Walley)
, which Roback ( 1985 ) synonymized with A. ( A .)
monilis
. However Saether ( 2011 ) has reestablished it as a valid species. The aedeagal complex in A. ( A .)
prorasha
(Kobayashi & Kubota 2002 , fig. 15 ) is very similar to that of A. ( A .)
basalis
drawn by Roback ( 1971 , figs 570, 607 ) and Saether ( 2011 , fig. 8 E, F).
